Node.definition: = member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= block made of clay in a mold and either dried in the sun or hardened in an oven; ► used as a building material, especially in places where stone or wood was scarce

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to carve|to portray|to draw|to mark out|to write
Node.definition: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= state of being surrounded by a group of people ► for purposes of war
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= fence of poles or stakes, sometimes reinforced with, or even made of earth and stones; ► used to fortify entrenchments
literally: to pour out a mound; hence: = causative action by which humans cast up a large mound of earth to protect themselves while surrounding an enemy
= earthen mound, cast up against the wall of a city ► in order to enable to enemy to scale the wall
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
literally: young ram; hence: = a log or other long, heavy piece of wood, covered on one end with metal; ► used by soldiers to strike the wall or gate of a city under siege repeatedly
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

= a thick plate made of pottery (and later of metal), with small depressions similar to a modern waffle iron; ► it was placed on three stones between which a fire was built; bread dough was then put on its surface and cooked
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= flat construction, ◄ normally made of stone, ► used as a divider of spaces, or to enclose a space
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= the area separating two or mores locations
= the area separating two or mores locations

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
literally: to establish (one's) face

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state of being surrounded by a group of people ► for purposes of war

= action by which a group of humans gather around a town with an army and surround it ► with the purpose of forcing it to surrender by cutting off all supplies, or by attacking it directly with the help of siege works
= object or event that reminds of something that has happened or as a confirmation of something that is yet to happen
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security
= side of a person's body, especially of the rump, right above the hip; ► place where people sometimes carried their small children; ≈ location where one's body is unprotected and vulnerable
= the direction facing left or northward from the perspective of the location in focus; in extension: one option as opposed to another

Node.gloss: to place (responsibility on someone) > to lay upon|to bring upon|to impose upon|to charge with|to commit to
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities hold (other) humans responsible for an event that has taken place or that is to take place in the future

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= the quantity of a number of objects or the frequency of a number of events

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security
literally: to hold; hence: = process by which humans are held responsible for a certain action or for the well being of others

= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to finish (one's) days; hence: = action by which people go through the motions of life for a particular amount of time

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= state in which a countable entity is forty in number

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= state of being surrounded by a group of people ► for purposes of war
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
literally: to establish (one's) face
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= causative action by which humans, deities, or animals remove an object that thinly covers another object
= piece of cord or chain; ◄ made by twisting together strands of palm fibres, linen, reeds, or gold; ► used for tying and keeping things together
= action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before
= side of a person's body, especially of the rump, right above the hip; ► place where people sometimes carried their small children; ≈ location where one's body is unprotected and vulnerable
= side of a person's body, especially of the rump, right above the hip; ► place where people sometimes carried their small children; ≈ location where one's body is unprotected and vulnerable
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
literally: to finish (one's) days; hence: = action by which people go through the motions of life for a particular amount of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state of being surrounded by a group of people ► for purposes of war
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= cereal plant bearing dense four sided spike of grain; ◄ Triticum; ► important source of flour for bread; ≈ its color used to be regarded as the ideal color for the skin

= a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

= product of an erect plant, not a vine, reaching to 1 meter (3 feet) in height; its stem branches only in the upper part, and it has no tendrils; it has white flowers that, when they ripen, form pods containing 3 6 large flat beans of a cream or tan color; ◄ Vicia faba or Faba vulgaris; ► used for food

= type of vegetable from a low branched plant with a weak stem; its flowers develop into a short pod with only one seed inside, about the size of a small pea, one type of which is reddish brown in color; ◄ Lens culinaris; ► typically used in soups and stews
= type of grain, reaching a height of about 90 cm.; ◄ |iPanicum miliaceum|i* or |iSorghum vulgare|i*; ► used for making bread or porridge; ≈ regarded as inferior to wheat (חִטָּה)

meaning unsure, probably: = type of grain with loose ears and triangular grains which do not loosen from the chaff when ripening; grows in relatively infertile and dry soil; with a sweet, nutty flavor; ◄ Triticum dicoccum; ► used for making bread; ≈ regarded as inferior to wheat (חִטָּה)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= state in which a countable entity is ninety in number

= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

Node.gloss: from time to time|regularly|at fixed times
Node.definition: literally: from time to time; hence: = a reference to relatively short uniform intervals
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

Node.gloss: from time to time|regularly|at fixed times
Node.definition: literally: from time to time; hence: = a reference to relatively short uniform intervals
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= state in which an entity is one out of six equal parts
= a unit of liquid measure of about 6 liters or 6 quarts; 4 hin make up 1 bath (בַּת)

Node.gloss: from time to time|regularly|at fixed times
Node.definition: literally: from time to time; hence: = a reference to relatively short uniform intervals
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

Node.gloss: from time to time|regularly|at fixed times
Node.definition: literally: from time to time; hence: = a reference to relatively short uniform intervals

= a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= waste matter remaining after food has been digested, discharged from the bowels of humans
= excrement; ◄ produced by humans and animals; ► source of pollution and impurity; ≈ regarded as filthy
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= causative action by which humans cook food using dry heat on a hot surface

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to drive out|to cast out|to disperse
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to leave their place or position using force

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
exclamation expressing grief and dismay
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= process by which humans, or objects are or become contaminated, ◄ as a result of contagious diseases or conditions, unlawful activities, or contact with what has been contaminated, ► which often results in their inability of being used or participating in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures
= the dead body of humans or animals
literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= the period of a person's life between childhood and adulthood
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

= meat which is considered unclean, ◄ because more than two days have passed after it was sacrificed, or because it was sacrificed to idols, or because it has been prepared in an inappropriate way; ► not to be eaten

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= excrement of animals, ► which can be used as fuel for baking

= large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth
= waste matter remaining after food has been digested, discharged from the bowels of humans
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

= state in which humans experience fear, anxiety, or distress ◄ out of uncertainty of what might happen to themselves or their beloved ones; ► which may express itself in trembling and shaking of the body

Node.gloss: to lack|to be in need (of something)
Node.definition: = state in which humans lack something that they are supposed to have
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

Node.gloss: a man ... his brother > one ... each other
Node.definition: = expression denoting a situation in which two people or objects that are regarded as masculine are involved in a reciprocal event
= state in which humans have lost their inner composure ◄ as a result of guilt
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
